item.title: SFP 142: Securing the Heart
item.description: Welcome. Today we are going to be talking about how the young person can secure their hearts for God as they face the world they live in. While these steps might be meant for the young, I find that they would likely work for anyone at any age. The basis of this question of ‘how can the young secure their hearts?’ originates from (Psa 119:9) BETH. Wherewithal shall a young man cleanse his way? by taking heed thereto according to thy word. We’re going to be spending this episode explaining how one can take heed to God’s word.

item.title: SFP 141: Living It Up
item.description: Welcome. Today I want to talk about the way we live here in America in this day and age. There are so many things that we do that just completely flies in the face of God and His commands as presented in the Bible. The thing is that some 78% of Americans claim to be Christians! If this was truly the case, the majority of us should be living the Word of God and the things that so many of us find shameful should only represent a very small minority.

item.title: SFP 140 Parables 2: The Sower
item.description: Welcome. Today I want to talk a little Jesus, as in His parables, and the meaning they have for us in our modern day lives. This time I want to take on the Parable of the Sower, or the Parable of the Four Soils. This parable teaches us about how we take the Word in our lives, it pretty much classifies everyone’s four main basic responses to God’s Word. If we are anything besides the ‘good’ soil, this is a call to repentance and a change of heart as well.

item.title: SFP 139: Occult Practices
item.description: Welcome. Today’s topic was inspired by a television show that I saw about a woman that is a practicing psychic. This made me think about how in our society we don’t blink twice when it comes to the supernatural or the occult. This in turn sent me to my Bible to find what God has to say about topic. The results of that search are what I want to talk about today.

item.title: SFP 138: Persecution and Death
item.description: Welcome. Today we have a grim topic, the one of death and persecution. To be more specific, we’re going to be talking about being persecuted and even executed for our religious beliefs, and just how common this is even in our modern world. We are also going to discuss how we should handle this persecution in our lives when it comes to us. And make no mistake, if we live in Christ as we should, it will come to us in one form or another.

item.title: SFP 137: Why Jesus Suffered
item.description: Welcome. The gospel message is that Jesus died for our sins according to the Scriptures as we see in Isaiah 53 and 1st Corinthians 15. We know that without the shedding of blood, there is no remission of sin. We find this in the Scriptures in Hebrews 15 and Ephesians 1. But the question could be asked why couldn’t Jesus have had a quick, less torturous death? Why all the suffering? Is there a reason for it all?

item.title: SFP 135: Be Not Conformed
item.description: Welcome. Today we are going to be talking about the world and how the Christian should relate to the world. Should Christians be conformed to this world? How should a Christian conduct themselves in the world? Where should a Christian put their affections? What about their values? Should the world shape our morals? Should we look to the world for entertainment? What about how we dress? Should we speak as the world speaks? Should we have worldly aspirations? How should the Christian use his spare time? These are the questions we are going to be answering today, as the Bible gives us a great deal of guidance in this very issue.

item.title: SFP 134: Parables 1: Good Samaritan
item.description: Welcome. Today we are going to be talking about the parable of the Good Samaritan that Jesus spoke of. This is one of the most famous parables in the Bible and we see laws, hospitals, and all kinds of other things named after the Good Samaritan. We’re going to learn about the details of this parable, and how we can apply the lesson Christ was teaching by telling it to our own lives.

item.title: SFP 133: Friends
item.description: Welcome. Today I want to talk about something that is big in all of our lives and that is friendship. Like that old song says, no man is an island. We all affect each other, and we tend to naturally form bonds and connections with those around us. In God’s Word, we are given much insight and information on how and who we should form friendly connections with, and how we can do so in a godly manner. With this, we can form good relationships, and avoid the difficult pitfalls that destroy so many friendships.

item.title: SFP 131: Truth Really Does Save Part 1
item.description: Welcome. Today we’re going to be talking about some claims made by a website that denies Christianity. The first point I want to make about our subject today is that I will not be covering every single word or even every single section of this website in our discussion. Firstly because much of it is atheistic conjecture and opinions, and I can only say ‘nu-uh’ so many times before we all get tired of it, and secondly because I’m not willing to devote 8-12 episodes purely to this one subject. I don’t have the attention span for it, and I don’t think you guys want us to dwell on this single subject for that long. We’re going to be looking at the claims they make, and will be addressing the ones that stick out to me, the ones that inspired me to speak out. The reason we’re taking on this exercise today is because the world is full of false information attacking the truth that God has presented the world, and I feel it’s important to occasionally stop and defend the faith so that people that hear these falsehoods can have a chance to hear the truth.

item.title: SFP 129: Worldliness
item.description: Welcome. Today I want to talk to you about worldliness. This is something that is consuming many Christians whole, and that’s a serious problem because we are told to stay away from worldliness by the Word of God. Our goal today is to identify the world, how the world presents itself today, and how we can overcome the world.

item.title: SFP 126: God's Love for Man
item.description: Welcome. Today we’re going to be talking about something very important, and something that everyone should be interested in: the love God has for mankind. Without God’s love where would we be? The value of this love cannot be overstated, and I think it’s clear why God’s love is so important. If He didn’t love us, we would be in a world of trouble! So today we are going to be talking about how God has shown His mighty love for mankind, so that we might all come to a deeper understanding about His love, along with the realization of the fact that God’s love is not something based purely on emotionalism. Instead God shows us His solid and real love through creation, through the Word, through the establishment of morality, through His plan for our salvation, and through the promise of eternal life. These are the points we’re going to be discussing today.

item.title: SFP 125: Return of the Joe (Bad News and You)
item.description: Welcome. Today we’re going to be talking about bad news, and how we deal with bad news when it comes our way. Furthermore, we’re going to talk about ways we can better handle bad news, and what the Bible has to say on the subject, and no, shooting the messenger isn’t a Biblically approved method of coping! Instead we are going to verify, act, pray, think, talk, accept, and rejoice.

item.title: SFP 124: God and You 1: Pray Without Ceasing
item.description: Welcome. Today we are going to start a series called “God and You”. In this series we’re going to be talking about the different things we need to do to grow our relationship with God, and how we can improve our spiritual standing. We’re going to be talking about things like prayer, discernment, and God’s will for our lives. Let’s kick off the series with an episode on the subject of prayer. The Bible tells us in (1Th 5:17) Pray without ceasing. There are some questions associated with this verse, such as ‘is this really what God wants us to do?’, ‘why is prayer so important?’ and finally, ‘how can we possibly pray without ceasing?’. Today we’re going to answer these questions and more!

item.title: SFP 123: Who Do You Love?
item.description: Welcome. Today we’re going to be digging into the book of 2 Timothy and look at the way people are going to act as the end comes towards us. The book tells us that perilous times are coming, and I think they are starting to arrive even now. When this time of troubles comes, people are going to stop caring about the things of God, and will start loving the corruptible things of the carnal world. We can see this happening all around us today, and so we’re going to break down the kinds of things the wayward people will love so that we can be smart and turn away, preventing ourselves from becoming bogged down in worldliness.

item.title: SFP 120: Inner Demons
item.description: Welcome. Today we’re going to be talking about inner demons, an issue we all have to face in our lives. We are going to be specifically speaking to the inner demons of selfishness, greediness, pride and lust. Our goal today is to be aware of these feelings, these demons if you will, and learn how to deal with them appropriately so that they do not overcome us and destroy our attempts at living a Christian life.

item.title: SFP 119: Ethic of Love
item.description: Welcome. Today we are going to be talking about love, and God’s ethical standard. If you look through the Bible, you will find that love is a constant ethical standard presented by God. We can see this ethical standard perfected in the person of Jesus Christ. There is no other system that can come close to the perfection of God’s ethic of love, though there are many systems in the world that try. Our goal today is to learn of God’s ethical system and apply it to our lives so that we might improve our walk with Christ.

item.title: SFP 113: Big Questions
item.description: Welcome. Today I want to talk about a few important questions. Firstly, who is God? And then secondly, who are we? These are probably two of the most relevant questions in our lives, alongside ‘why are we here’ and/or ‘what is our purpose?’ I want to answer those questions of identity today, so that maybe we can come to understand our place and role in this life. By knowing who God is, and who we are, we can come much closer to answering that third question of purpose.

item.title: SFP 111: Big Fish
item.description: Welcome. Today we are going to be talking about a big fish story. Where I come from, I was surrounded by lakes in my hometown, and I’ve heard some pretty good fish stories in my day. I’ve heard of fish as big as a log, I’ve heard of them being as big as a VW beetle, but we’re going to blow those stories out of the water with today’s topic, which is Jonah and his ‘big fish’! We’re going to be looking at Jonah, his life, and the lessons we can learn from his story.

item.title: SFP 110: All About the Money?
item.description: The world is filled with usurpers and robbers, con artists and deceivers. We are going to talk about some of the more famous false teachers today. We are going to see that these people are just the scum of the Earth. Sadly, people flock to these false teachers even when the Bible has warned us this would happen.
